node.title: Eddie Obeid's bid to get out of jail in time for Christmas
node.alt: A man with grey hair and glasses
node.description: Lawyers for Eddie Obeid and Ian Macdonald say the former NSW Labor ministers should be released on home detention ahead of an appeal against their conspiracy convictions.
node.content:
["Former NSW Labor ministers Eddie Obeid and Ian Macdonald have launched a bid to be out of jail in time\u00a0for Christmas\u00a0ahead of an appeal against their conspiracy convictions.\u00a0", "The former ministers and Eddie Obeid's son Moses\u00a0have faced the Supreme Court via video for a bail hearing.\u00a0", "The men were jailed in October\u00a0after Justice Elizabeth Fullerton ruled they were \"opportunistic\"\u00a0and \"complicit\"\u00a0in knowing Macdonald would breach his ministerial duties to rig a mine tender that gave the Obeid family\u00a0a $30 million windfall when he was resources minister.\u00a0", "Eddie Obeid, 77, was given a minimum three years and 10 months jail\u00a0sentence, while Moses Obeid, 53, will spend at least three years behind bars.", "The longest sentence was saved for Macdonald, 72, who was jailed for at least five years and three months.", "The landmark case followed\u00a0a sensational Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) inquiry almost a decade ago.", "The money has never been repaid.\u00a0", "", "
Ian Macdonald was given the lengthiest jail term of the three men.(AAP: Joel Carrett.)
", "Wearing matching prison greens, Eddie and\u00a0Moses Obeid today sat together at a small table in Cooma Correctional Facility, passing each other notes during the hearing.", "Eddie Obeid at times had his eyes closed.", "Macdonald appeared via video link from Lithgow Correctional Centre, frowning for much of the bail hearing.", "The men's lawyers argued they should be released on home detention\u00a0until their appeal.\u00a0", "Macdonald's barrister, Philip Strickland, SC, expressed concern\u00a0an appeal was\u00a0unlikely to start before September 2022, with a judgement delayed until 2023.\u00a0", "\"It's not in the public interest that a person who otherwise poses no risk to the community, would be incarcerated for a significant period of time when a court later finds he is not guilty of an offence,\"\u00a0Mr Strickland said.", "", "
Moses Obeid was jailed for at least three years behind bars.(AAP: Dean Lewins)
", "Justice Helen Wilson, who presided over the bail application, disagreed that there would be any delay.\u00a0", "\"No-one wants to see someone sitting in jail if they shouldn't be there,\"\u00a0she said.\u00a0", "Eddie Obeid's barrister, April Francis, said Justice Fullerton made a \"critical error\" in her guilty verdict against her client.", "Moses Obeid's barrister, Bret Walker\u00a0SC, said if his conviction was\u00a0quashed, he would have\u00a0already served much of his sentence by the time he was released.\u00a0", "Crown prosecutor Sophie Callan SC said the men's grounds for appeal \"do not enjoy reasonable prospects\".", "She said because the men had been convicted their \"presumption of innocence has been rebutted\".", "Justice Wilson adjourned the matter until Friday."]
